review.title: On the Parametric Study of Lubricating Oil Production using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) Approach
review.abstract: In this study, an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) approach is utilized to perform a parametric study on the process of extraction of lubricants from heavy petroleum cuts. To train the model, we used field data collected from an industrial plant. Operational conditions of feed and solvent flow rate, Temperature of streams and mixing rate were considered as the input to the model, whereas the flow rate of the main product was considered as the output of the ANN model. A feed-forward Multi-Layer Perceptron Neural Network was successfully applied to capture the relationship between inputs and output parameters.

metadata.title: On the Parametric Study of Lubricating Oil Production using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) Approach

sections.text: In this study, an artificial neural network (ANN) approach is used to perform a parametric study of the process of extracting lubricants from heavy petroleum sections. To train the model, we used field data collected from an industrial plant. Operating conditions of conveyor and solvent flow, flow temperature and mixing rate were considered as input into the model, while the flow rate of the main product was considered as output of the ANN model. An upstream neural multi-layer perceptron network was successfully applied to capture the relationship between input and output parameters. Keywords: solvent extraction, lubricating oil, machine learning, artificial neural network (ANN)

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: It is necessary to remove aromatic compounds from heavy oil sections in order to improve the quality of the lubricating oil base oils produced [1-2]. The extraction of aromatic compounds from lubricating oil sections usually takes place through a liquid-liquid (solvent) extraction process. Several works have been carried out to find a suitable solvent for the extraction of aromatic hydrocarbons from lubricating oil sections [3-5]. Sulfolane is strongly used as a solvent for this process due to its high selectivity in the extraction of aromatics. This compound is suitable for the extraction of light and heavy vacuum distillates [6-9]. In a liquid-liquid extraction process (solvent), two flows of feed and solvents within the column must be kept in contact with each other. Studies on the efficiency of conventional extraction contactors show that RDC (rotating disc contactors) extraction containers can be considered the most efficient of the extraction parameters of DC-13.

sections.heading: 2. Materials and Methods
sections.text: 2.1 Chemical Extraction Process One of the ways to produce lubricating oils is through solvent extraction processes where the starting material, usually a lubricating oil cut, comes into contact with an extraction solvent, in this case sulfolans [23]. In this paper, industrial field data was used to train an ANN model capable of predicting the performance of column 2.2 Neural Network Architecture A Feed-Forward Multilayer Perceptron Neural Network. (These parameters were carefully selected to represent the real system.) The input parameters were independent of one and the other and were those that most affected the flow rate of the main product, including the temperature of the starting and solvent, the rotation rate of discs and solvents to the starting parameters, and the only output parameter was selected to represent the flow rate of the main product flow.

sections.heading: 3. Results and Discussion
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 3.1 ANN modeling/Pattern Generation
sections.text: The optimal number of neuron nodes in the hidden layer was selected based on the minimum values of the (MSE) and (Error%) of different ANN models created using different numbers of nodes. Table 2 lists these parameters according to 100,000 iterations of the model. Looking at the results, we found that a network of 7 hidden nodes has the lowest values of MSE and Error%, which is best in line with our objectives. The average relative error and maximum relative error for the network outputs after training the 4-7-1 network are listed in Table 3: To further validate the accuracy of the ANN model, 80 data points that were not involved in the modeling process were used for comparison purposes.

sections.heading: 4. Conclusion
sections.text: It was possible to safely perform a parametric study of the performance of an RDC column in terms of its operating conditions using an artificial neural network method. Results showed that increasing the ratio of solvents to feed increases the amount of faromates extracted from the feed stream. Increasing the rotation rate will improve the extraction process.
